severity_system.description: Hindi profanity severity classification considering Indian cultural values and regional variations
severity_system.methodology: Based on sociolinguistic research across Hindi-speaking regions and contemporary Indian social dynamics
severity_system.cultural_context: Reflects traditional Indian family values, religious diversity, and modern urban-rural divides

1.name: हल्का (Mild)
1.description: हल्की अपशब्द भाषा जो अनौपचारिक परिस्थितियों में स्वीकार्य हो सकती है
1.description_en: Mild profanity that may be acceptable in informal circumstances
1.cultural_notes: Still avoided in presence of elders, women, or religious contexts

2.name: मध्यम (Moderate)
2.description: अशिष्ट भाषा जो मध्यम अपराध का कारण बनती है
2.cultural_notes: Causes social disapproval, especially from traditional families

3.name: तीव्र (Strong)
3.description: अत्यधिक आपत्तिजनक भाषा जो गंभीर सामाजिक नाराजगी का कारण बनती है
3.description_en: Highly offensive language causing serious social disapproval
3.cultural_notes: Can result in serious social consequences and family conflicts

4.name: अत्यंत तीव्र (Severe)
4.description: अत्यंत आपत्तिजनक भाषा, सभी सार्वजनिक संदर्भों में वर्जित
4.description_en: Extremely offensive language, taboo in all public contexts
4.cultural_notes: Violates fundamental Indian cultural values, can provoke violence

family_hierarchy.description: Indian family structure significantly affects language acceptability

elder_presence.notes: Extreme respect required for elders, all profanity highly inappropriate

parent_child_dynamics.notes: Children expected to use respectful language with parents

family_honor_context.notes: Family honor attacks violate core cultural values

religious_context.description: Religious diversity and spirituality affect profanity perception

hindu_traditional.notes: Traditional Hindu values emphasize pure speech and ahimsa

muslim_communities.notes: Islamic emphasis on respectful speech and family honor

religious_festivals.notes: Religious occasions require especially pure speech

delhi_ncr.notes: More cosmopolitan, slightly more tolerant of casual profanity

rajasthan.notes: Traditional honor culture, very sensitive to family insults

mumbai_hindi_speakers.notes: Cosmopolitan film industry influence, more tolerant

caste_considerations.description: Caste dynamics affect both usage and perception

upper_caste_expectations.notes: Expected to maintain higher linguistic standards

caste_based_insults.legal_implications: Illegal under SC/ST Prevention of Atrocities Act

progressive_anti_caste.notes: Anti-caste movements more tolerant of challenging traditional norms

generational_differences.description: Significant age-related differences in tolerance and usage

elderly_60plus.religious_influence: High religious observance affects language attitudes

middle_aged_40_60.notes: Traditional values with some modern flexibility

young_adults_20_40.notes: More tolerant but still culturally constrained
young_adults_20_40.education_factor: Higher education correlates with slight tolerance increase

youth_teenagers.notes: Most tolerant, influenced by global media and internet culture
youth_teenagers.family_pressure: Still heavily constrained by family expectations

gender_dynamics.description: Strong gender differences in usage permissions and expectations

male_speakers.notes: More social tolerance for male profanity use in appropriate contexts

female_speakers.notes: Much higher social stigma for women using profanity
female_speakers.family_honor: Female language use reflects on entire family honor

gender_specific_insults.notes: Insults targeting women particularly severe in patriarchal context

educational_socioeconomic.description: Education and class significantly affect language attitudes

higher_education.notes: Slightly more tolerant, exposed to diverse perspectives
higher_education.english_education: English-educated more familiar with global attitudes

lower_socioeconomic.notes: May use more profanity but still sensitive to family/religious insults

elite_upper_class.notes: Expected to maintain sophisticated linguistic standards
elite_upper_class.code_switching: May use English profanity instead of Hindi

urban_rural_divide.description: Significant differences between urban and rural attitudes

major_cities.notes: More cosmopolitan, diverse exposure, film industry influence

rural_villages.notes: Very traditional, strong community values, elder respect paramount

bollywood_media_influence.description: Film industry and media affect profanity normalization

mainstream_bollywood.notes: Normalized certain mild profanity through popular culture

web_series_content.notes: Digital content more permissive, youth audience

traditional_media.notes: Traditional TV and radio maintain conservative standards

family_honor_violations.description: Attacks on family honor, particularly mothers and sisters
family_honor_violations.social_consequences: Can provoke violence, permanent social ostracism

lgbtq_discrimination.legal_context: Growing legal protections and social awareness

hinglish_code_switching.urban_phenomenon: More common in educated urban contexts

age_restrictions.16_21: Level 1 sometimes acceptable with heavy cultural context
age_restrictions.21_plus: Context, family situation, and regional culture dependent

cultural_sensitivity_requirements.family_contexts: Extreme sensitivity to family honor required
cultural_sensitivity_requirements.gender_considerations: Different standards for male vs female users and targets

legal_considerations.cybercrime_legislation: IT Act covers online harassment and hate speech
legal_considerations.film_certification: Censor board guidelines for media content
legal_considerations.regional_variations: Different states may have additional restrictions
